alert.note: Alert for St. Charles; Upper Jefferson (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 5:06PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Charles and northwestern Jefferson Parishes through 600 PM CDT... At 505 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing funnel clouds over Waggaman, or near Avondale, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tropical funnel clouds and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Metairie, Avondale, Hahnville, Marrero, Laplace, Jefferson, Harahan, Westwego, Norco, Elmwood, Montz, Bridge City, River Ridge, Ama, Destrehan, Waggaman, New Sarpy, St. Rose, Luling and Taft. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 212 and 231. Interstate 310 between mile markers 1 and 7. FUNNEL CLOUDS...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
